Tom Becker:

Limit increase

Tom Becker:

It can be multiple reasons why this transaction is showing up for you.

1. You initiated the payment to the hotel and gave them a wrong
expiry date of your card. When this happens, the merchant (in this case the hotel) get the message, that the provided data is not correct and declines the transaction.

2a. Someone else initiated the payment. Here, it can be that a customer of a hotel has a credit card number which is almost the same as yours and mistyped when giving the hotel the payment information, leading to the same situation as in 1.

2b. Someone else initiated the payment for fraud reasons. In this case, they would have your credit card number, but not the expiry date and would try to pay using
your card number by guessing the expiry date. This is highly unlikely in this case though, since normally fraudulent transactions aren't being done through hotels.

Depending on your statement in the beginning, I assume 2a is why this transaction showed up for you.

message(by Pliant): Hi I'm Fin, an AI agent that automatically answers questions based on your support content.
replies:
Pliant:

I have ingested your content, you can give me a spin! Just type any question your customers might have. Don't be shy, I love a good chat!

Preview User:

where do I find my credit card details

Pliant:

You can find your Pliant credit card details by accessing the cardholder app. If you have a physical Pliant card, the card number and CVV are printed on the card itself. For both physical and virtual cards, you can view these details in the cardholder app by opening the Wallet section and navigating to the desired card. To reveal the full card number and CVV, hover over the card image and click "Show card details." You also have the option to copy the card number with a single click for use in a merchant's payment interface. It's important to remember that these secure card details are only accessible to the cardholder to whom the card was issued and should never be shared with anyone else to reduce the risk of fraud and maintain the security of your organization's funds. Additionally, the secure details of a card, such as the card number, CVV, and PIN, can only be accessed by the cardholder personally via the cardholder app, and not by any other member of your organization, including owners and admins.

Lauri Loikkanen:

Hi Rodrigo! We have one card holder who have tried with two virtual cards to do a transaction and it's keeps getting rejected. with following error messages:

Lauri Loikkanen:

Cardholder authentication failed
The cardholder could not be authenticated. Please try again. If the issue persists, please contact our customer service.

Lauri Loikkanen:

Incorrect expiry date
The card expiry date entered was incorrect. Please confirm the correct expiry date and try again. You can view the expiry date in the Wallet section of the cardholder app.

Lauri Loikkanen:

Any ideas?

Rodrigo Sartori:

Let me check how I can help you

Rodrigo Sartori:

Card declining with error Cardholder authentication failed means that we did not receive any request from the Merchant.

Rodrigo Sartori:

There are various reasons why the SCA process may fail:

  • The merchant does not send a request for SCA even though it is required by our side in order to complete the card payment (this is common with non-European merchants and with high-value transactions).
  • The customer entered the code received via SMS incorrectly.
  • The customer or the merchant cancels the payment

Rodrigo Sartori:

Therefore, we suggest you contact the merchant as the issue is highly on their side.
